reviewText: Good:The actual workout part is good. I have her advanced and it is better as this one is very basic but since this one is her level 1 I understand that.Bad:She is a bit dull and the green screen is terrible.  She takes too many breaks and they are too long.  I normally do other sets while I am waiting for her workout to start again.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Going by previews and negative reviews I expected to not like this DVD and the instructor much, but being the exercise DVD addict that I am, I had to try it for myself. I have tried and own many Kbell workout DVDs and in my opinion there is nothing better than Art Of Strength. However, once I got started with this one, I was surprised how much I liked Lisa's personality. She is very calm and cues well. I used a 20 lb Kbell but could have gone heavier (I'm female) because of the low rep count which is supposedly targeted towards beginners.So, here is the reason I gave it only 3 stars: there is no warmup, cool down or stretch, the on-screen instructions show how many reps and length of rest for beginner, intermed, and advanced, but Lisa only demonstrates the beginner count. So, in a circuit of several exercises the rep count is 5, one after the other, when it should be 10 for adavanced, but you can't follow along and do 10 reps. There should have been a separate chapter for the advanced workout. On the other hand, a true beginner might be overwhelmed because the pace is quick and there is a variety of exercises. I also fast-forwarded through the lengthy rest periods.What I did like: Using a very heavy Kbell is doable and provides quite a challenge. (I felt it in my shoulders and abs). The cardio sections get your heart rate up effectively with burpees, mountain climbers, etc. even though it's short. Lisa's physique motivated me and I liked her personality. She has good form. The workouts (doing all 3 chapters) can be done in a short amount of time especially if you skip through the breaks so as an add-on this is not bad at all. I did feel good after the workout.There is mentioning of her next DVD which is supposed to be more advanced and I'm curious how it will be. I hope she reads reviews to make the next one better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Kettlebell BombshellInstructor - Lisa BalashDuration - variesPros - Lisa spends a good half hour on instruction on the different kettlebell movements. I really liked this! Her explanations are very clear and detailed. There are a lot more moves demonstrated with this DVD compared to many of the the other kettlebell DVDs that I own. After that there are three workouts, one for lower body, one for upper body and a cardio workout.Cons - Lisa definitely practices the various swings differently from what I learned with Iron Core and Kettlebell Konnection. Instead of keeping the head and chest up, she "follows" the movement of the kettlebell. I do not like this. The workouts are super short, but could be repeated. Definitely a slower pace when it comes to the workouts.Summary - I think I like this DVD, at least the variety and clear, detailed instructions. I wish the workouts were longer but as previously noted - they could be repeated. With the first two workouts, I did not feel like I was getting much in the way of cardio.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The rest periods are boring during the beginner's workout but my husband and I do knee lifts or stretching or marching in place while waiting if we don't need the rest.  Some exercisers would need the rest.  The tutorial is GREAT if you are new to kettlebell training.  She goes slowly enough and reiterates the precautions which some instructors don't emphasize enough or at all.  We did the first workout then switched to Jillian Michaels kettlebell workout.  We will do the second workout tomorrow, then the third again and keep alternating with our other DVD's.  Bob Harper has a kettlebell workout that is much faster paced.  Ms. Balash certainly has some really good points that make this one worth the investment and worth going back to to freshen up the kettlebell workouts which ARE FUN!
summary: I agree the rest periods are boring but....

reviewText: I do a lot of fitness DVDs and kettle bell is starting to be my workout of choice.  I have probably 8 different kettle bell DVDs and this, is, by, far, the, best.  Can't say enough about it.  Makes me get up and get it done.

reviewText: Although I purchased this DVD a couple of months ago, I am just now getting around to trying it.  There are 4 different programs on the dvd.....instructional, upper body, lower body and cardio.  So far I have only done the instructional one.  The instructor is very specific on the proper way to do the movements.  I have a few other kettlebell dvds, but I think she goes into a lot of detail about the movements.  She also shows the movements from a side angle and a front angle, so that you can see the proper way of doing it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have viewed a number of Kettlebell WO's, especially with female instructors. MOst are boring, too aerobic in nature and use light bells. This one is an instructional video at the beginning, emphasizing form always. I admit the rest periods can be longer if you're using a lighter bell weight but up that and you'll be thankful. She gives a rundown of beginning, intermediate and advanced with reps and rest. It's the way to start a program, no doubt.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this only because it had 5 stars w/ great reviews.  What a disappointment once I received it and watched it.  As the other reviewers have written: you do one sequence, then get a 1, 2 or 3 minute rest period.  I never worked up a sweat.  I didn't feel like I had done a workout, because I hadn't. The DVD that comes with Bob Harper's kettlebell you buy at Target is better. That one gives me a workout. If you want a workout with kettlebells, do not waste your money on this one.  I should have sent it back and asked for a refund.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I attend live kettlebell classes and was so happy to find this workout to do additional training at home.  Not only is she using correct form and teaching the correct method people will actually see how a true kettlebell routine is supposed to be.  There are way to many so called instructors releasing dvds for kettlebell workouts that not only use improper form but horrible instruction.  This dvd is not one of those.  This dvd is taught by someone actually certified and trains kettlebell.  If you really want to learn how to do this form of fitness the correct way this is the dvd you should purchase and recommend to all your friends.  Lisa is top notch and I look forward to any future releases she has.  The workout does what it's supposed to do it breaks down the moves and shows you correct form and structure.  If you want more of a workout fast forward to the next section, trust me you will get your heartrate up and feel the burn.  This is one of the best ways to not only train for strength but it also involves a great cardio workout as well.  Well structured dvd with great emphasis on proper form and techinques.  This is how kettlebell dvds should be made.  If you want a great beginners dvd this is it.
summary: The best taught professional Kettlebell workout you could ever purchase!
